column4: During the "Copy remaining packages to hard disk" stage, I receive an error:  "archive-copier: error: `cp -a "/cdrom/pool/main/x/xscreensaver/xscreensaver-data_4.21-4ubuntu17_i386.deb" "/target/var/cache/archive-copier/desktop/xscreensaver-data_4.21-4ubuntu17_i386.deb"` failed with code 1".
Does anyone know what this is?
I think ubuntu is not created enough space in the tmpfs during installation.  How can I increase it?
what is an LVM volume and do I need it?
LVM = logical volume management.
how do I know if I should select this option during installation?
if you're unsure, don't do it.
the default works well enough, and if one day you find that you need LVM, e.g. for accessing multiple hd's as one large pseudo-partition, you can still read up on it and add it on.
it requires 400MB, but I see my tmpfs does not have that much available.  Is there a way to increase the size of the tmpfs during installation?  Or is there a way to workaround this issue?  Thanks.
not sure - haven't heard of such a problem before.
how much RAM do you have?
yes.
well, it requires 400MB, but I do a df command and see that I have only 70MB allocated on tmpfs.
memtotal = 192016 kB
I don't think this is a tmpfs issue.
well where else would the installation copy the packages to?
to your root partition.
during installation the root partition has not been created as far as I can tell
it must have, it wouldn't be copying packages otherwise. Sorry student, have to go. I'll check if you're still around in half an hour.
